testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlDMSControlRequest dialog as an OC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.5.4.4 [Need to Display a Message on a Remote DMS] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Operator Identifier - Device Control Acknowledge is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.4.2.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N40R412_Operator_Identifier___Device_Control_Acknowledge_Supported = ${TMDD_N40R412_Operator_Identifier___Device_Control_Acknowledge_Supported}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Operator Lock Identifier is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.4.2.2.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N40R413_Operator_Lock_Identifier_Supported = ${TMDD_N40R413_Operator_Lock_Identifier_Supported}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Operator Last Revised Date and Time - Device Control is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.4.2.2.3). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N40R414_Operator_Last_Revised_Date_and_Time___Device_Control_Supported = ${TMDD_N40R414_Operator_Last_Revised_Date_and_Time___Device_Control_Supported}
Step 5 CONFIGURE: Define the message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: RequestMessage: ${RequestMessage}
Step 6 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorResponseExpected: ${ErrorResponseExpected}
Step 7 CONFIGURE: IF ErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorTypeExpected: ${ErrorTypeExpected}

Step 8 REQUEST-RESPONSE-EC with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlDMSControlRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N40R612_Send_DMS_Control_Response_Upon_Request_Parameter REQUESTMESSAGE = RequestMessage ERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = ErrorResponseExpected ERRORTYPEEXPECTED = ErrorTypeExpected
Step 9 IF ErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 9.1 VERIFY that element deviceControlResponseMsg exists.
Step 9.2 VERIFY that element organization-information exists within deviceControlResponseMsg.
Step 9.3 VERIFY that element device-id exists within deviceControlResponseMsg.
Step 9.4 VERIFY that element request-id exists within deviceControlResponseMsg.
Step 9.5 VERIFY that element request-status exists within deviceControlResponseMsg.
Step 9.6 VERIFY that element deviceControlResponseMsg exists.
Step 9.7 IF TMDD_N40R412_Operator_Identifier___Device_Control_Acknowledge_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 9.7.1 VERIFY that element operator-id exists within deviceControlResponseMsg.
Step 9.8 IF TMDD_N40R413_Operator_Lock_Identifier_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 9.8.1 VERIFY that element operator-lock-id exists within deviceControlResponseMsg.
Step 9.9 IF TMDD_N40R414_Operator_Last_Revised_Date_and_Time___Device_Control_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 9.9.1 VERIFY that element operator-last-revised exists within deviceControlResponseMsg.
Step 9.10 VERIFY that the values within the RESPONSE message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content
